column3:
ACK, though I'd go further and remove -logtimestamps entirely.

Rebase please.

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/959e62f0c889788e7775d5953668ce0cc5c1fea8 for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/cu

As an interesting bit of history, IIRC the reason they were off by default is that Satoshi had a paranoia attack and was worried about someone gathering logs from lots of nodes to correlate timestamps. In a world where intelligence agencies tap major fibre backbones and other people simply connect to every node and time relays, it seems clear to me that the value of having more useful logs massive
